data.title: Email the Governor's Office
data.meta_description: Use this form to email the Governor's office.
data.text:
The governor doesn’t have jurisdiction over city, town, or county issues. All questions about these issues should be sent to your elected representative of local government or your Massachusetts State Representative.

Find your state legislators

Find your city or town officials

The governor doesn’t have jurisdiction over federal agencies or programs, such as Medicare, Social Security, and Immigration. Questions about these issues should be sent to federal representatives.

Find your U.S. Representative

Find your U.S. Senator

You can also contact U.S. Sen. Ed Markey or U.S. Sen. Elizabeth Warren.

The governor’s office cannot provide legal advice or assistance to constituents. The governor cannot intervene in court cases or resolve judicial matters like complaints against judges or legal offices. If you need legal assistance but can’t afford an attorney, contact:

Massachusetts Bar Association Lawyer Referral: (617) 654-0400

Greater Boston Legal Services: (617) 371-1234

Northeast Legal Aid: (978) 458-1465

Community Legal Aid: (800) 649-3718

If you have a complaint against a judge or the courts, call the Massachusetts Commission on Judicial Conduct at (617) 725-8050.
